main event: Multiple civilians spotted a brilliant silver object in the sky, traveling at great speeds and emitting occasional puffs of smoke or vapor of a grayish color in Boise, Idaho on 5 July 1949. The object maneuvered in steep loops and turns before disappearing from sight.
interesting points: The object was estimated to be traveling at about 400,000 ft. and at 1500 mph by one of the witnesses.
It appeared to emit occasional puffs of smoke or vapor of a grayish color.
The object was circular and about the size of the bottom of a 55-gallon oil drum.
The object seemed to be quite high and displayed excellent stability and control.
The witnesses had considerable difficulty agreeing on various points concerning the object sighted.
